answers.answer: I've been getting those lately but it's due to the heat and dehydration I believe. Its very hot where I am and we have no air conditioning so I barely sleep as I'm already so uncomfortable and then the added heat is awful. So I wake up feeling hungover! I try to pound as much water as I can throughout the day especially when I'm outside, but sometimes no matter how much water I get I still get those headaches in the morning.

I don't know how far along you are but at 35 weeks my doc said if I get headaches that won't go away with Tylenol that it could be one of the first signs of preeclampsia. However you mentioned you already have a perception from your doctor so idk. Maybe your dehydrated since that is what hangover headaches are from..? I would ask your dr. Two days is a long time.

I'm 19 weeks. And I drink water non stop all day. That's all I drink and I make a habit to drink my body weight in water so I don't think it's that. It's hot where I live also but I haven't been venturing outside.I've been over my headaches w my doctor and I have no other symptoms for it to be preeclampsia so idk. It's so aggravating not knowing what to do about em. :((
Ive experinced those headaches nothing works

question: I have had one of those headaches you get after a night of drinking, like I'm hungover for 2 days now ! Tylenol isn't helping and even my prescription my doc gave me for tension headaches isn't helping. It's a horrible feeling. I feel so yuck! Has anyone had these also and what did you do for them that worked? Should I call my doctor???
title: Headache feels like I'm hungover
